intro: Aeschynomene histrix var. multijuga, commonly known as the hairy lespedeza, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers in late summer, which are followed by small, three-lobed pods. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated as a forage plant.
